Definition.name: TimeFromParts

Definition.name: SecondsFromParts

Documentation.firstline: Combines date and time components to create a seconds type
Documentation.return: A Seconds_t value created by combining the fields.
Documentation.content: Combines date and time components to create a seconds type. The date must be represented within the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600.

param.name: is_local_time
param.desc: TRUE if the datetime components are expressed in local time rather than UTC, FALSE if the components are expressed in UTC. Optional, defaults to FALSE.

Signature.name: SecondsFromParts
Signature.param: (INTEGER2 year, UNSIGNED1 month, UNSIGNED1 day, UNSIGNED1 hour, UNSIGNED1 minute, UNSIGNED1 second, BOOLEAN is_local_time = FALSE)

Documentation.firstline: Converts the number of seconds since epoch to a structure containing date and time parts
Documentation.return: Module with exported attributes for year, month, day, hour, minute, second, day_of_week, date and time.
Documentation.content: Converts the number of seconds since epoch to a structure containing date and time parts. The result must be representable within the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600.

param.name: seconds
param.desc: The number of seconds since epoch.

Documentation.firstline: Converts the number of microseconds since epoch to the number of seconds since epoch
Documentation.return: The number of seconds since epoch.
Documentation.content: Converts the number of microseconds since epoch to the number of seconds since epoch.

param.name: timestamp
param.desc: The number of microseconds since epoch.

Definition.name: FromGregorianYMD

Documentation.firstline: Combines year, month, day in the Gregorian calendar to create the number days since 31st December 1BC
Documentation.return: The number of elapsed days (1 Jan 1AD = 1)
Documentation.content: Combines year, month, day in the Gregorian calendar to create the number days since 31st December 1BC.

param.name: month
param.desc: The month (1-12). A missing value (0) is treated as 1.

param.name: day
param.desc: The day (1..daysInMonth). A missing value (0) is treated as 1.

Definition.Signature: Days_t FromGregorianYMD(INTEGER2 year, UNSIGNED1 month, UNSIGNED1 day)

Documentation.content: Returns a number representing the day of the year indicated by the given date. The date must be in the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600.

Documentation.firstline: Returns a number representing the day of the week indicated by the given date
Documentation.return: A number 1-7 representing the day of the week, where 1 = Sunday.
Documentation.content: Returns a number representing the day of the week indicated by the given date. The date must be in the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600.

Documentation.firstline: Converts a string to a Date_t using the relevant string format
Documentation.return: The date that was matched in the string. Returns 0 if failed to match or if the date components match but the result is an invalid date. Supported characters: %B Full month name %b or %h Abbreviated month name %d Day of month (two digits) %e Day of month (two digits, or a space followed by a single digit) %m Month (two digits) %t Whitespace %y year within century (00-99) %Y Full year (yyyy) %j Julian day (1-366) Common date formats American '%m/%d/%Y' mm/dd/yyyy Euro '%d/%m/%Y' dd/mm/yyyy Iso format '%Y-%m-%d' yyyy-mm-dd Iso basic 'Y%m%d' yyyymmdd '%d-%b-%Y' dd-mon-yyyy e.g., '21-Mar-1954'
Documentation.content: Converts a string to a Date_t using the relevant string format. The resulting date must be representable within the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600.

param.name: format
param.desc: The format of the input string. (See documentation for strftime)

Documentation.firstline: Converts a string to a date using the relevant string format
Documentation.return: The date that was matched in the string. Returns 0 if failed to match.
Documentation.content: Converts a string to a date using the relevant string format.

param.name: format
param.desc: The format of the input string. (See documentation for strftime)

Documentation.firstline: Converts a string to a Time_t using the relevant string format
Documentation.return: The time that was matched in the string. Returns 0 if failed to match. Supported characters: %H Hour (two digits) %k (two digits, or a space followed by a single digit) %M Minute (two digits) %S Second (two digits) %t Whitespace
Documentation.content: Converts a string to a Time_t using the relevant string format.

param.name: format
param.desc: The format of the input string. (See documentation for strftime)

Definition.name: MatchDateString

Documentation.firstline: Matches a string against a set of date string formats and returns a valid Date_t object from the first format that successfully parses the string
Documentation.return: The date that was matched in the string. Returns 0 if failed to match.
Documentation.content: Matches a string against a set of date string formats and returns a valid Date_t object from the first format that successfully parses the string.

param.name: formats
param.desc: A set of formats to check against the string. (See documentation for strftime)

Definition.Signature: Date_t MatchDateString(STRING date_text, SET OF VARSTRING formats)

Definition.name: MatchTimeString

Documentation.firstline: Matches a string against a set of time string formats and returns a valid Time_t object from the first format that successfully parses the string
Documentation.return: The time that was matched in the string. Returns 0 if failed to match.
Documentation.content: Matches a string against a set of time string formats and returns a valid Time_t object from the first format that successfully parses the string.

param.name: formats
param.desc: A set of formats to check against the string. (See documentation for strftime)

Definition.Signature: Time_t MatchTimeString(STRING time_text, SET OF VARSTRING formats)

Documentation.firstline: Formats a date as a string
Documentation.return: Blank if date cannot be formatted, or the date in the requested format.
Documentation.content: Formats a date as a string.

param.name: format
param.desc: The format template to use for the conversion; see strftime() for appropriate values. The maximum length of the resulting string is 255 characters. Optional; defaults to '%Y-%m-%d' which is YYYY-MM-DD.

Documentation.firstline: Formats a time as a string
Documentation.return: Blank if the time cannot be formatted, or the time in the requested format.
Documentation.content: Formats a time as a string.

param.name: format
param.desc: The format template to use for the conversion; see strftime() for appropriate values. The maximum length of the resulting string is 255 characters. Optional; defaults to '%H:%M:%S' which is HH:MM:SS.

Documentation.firstline: Converts a Seconds_t value into a human-readable string using a format template
Documentation.return: The converted seconds as a string.
Documentation.content: Converts a Seconds_t value into a human-readable string using a format template.

param.name: format
param.desc: The format template to use for the conversion; see strftime() for appropriate values. The maximum length of the resulting string is 255 characters. Optional; defaults to '%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S' which is YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.

Documentation.firstline: Formats a date as a string
Documentation.return: Blank if date cannot be formatted, or the date in the requested format.
Documentation.content: Formats a date as a string.

param.name: format
param.desc: The format the date is output in. (See documentation for strftime)

Definition.name: AdjustDate

Documentation.firstline: Adjusts a date by incrementing or decrementing year, month and/or day values
Documentation.return: The adjusted Date_t value.
Documentation.content: Adjusts a date by incrementing or decrementing year, month and/or day values. The date must be in the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600. If the new calculated date is invalid then it will be normalized according to mktime() rules. Example: 20140130 + 1 month = 20140302.

param.name: year_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the year value; optional, defaults to zero.

param.name: month_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the month value; optional, defaults to zero.

param.name: day_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the day of month value; optional, defaults to zero.

Signature.name: AdjustDate
Signature.param: (Date_t date, INTEGER2 year_delta = 0, INTEGER4 month_delta = 0, INTEGER4 day_delta = 0)

Definition.Signature: Date_t AdjustDate(Date_t date, INTEGER2 year_delta = 0, INTEGER4 month_delta = 0, INTEGER4 day_delta = 0)

Documentation.firstline: Adjusts a date by adding or subtracting seconds
Documentation.return: The adjusted Date_t value.
Documentation.content: Adjusts a date by adding or subtracting seconds. The date must be in the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600. If the new calculated date is invalid then it will be normalized according to mktime() rules. Example: 20140130 + 172800 seconds = 20140201.

param.name: seconds_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the date, in seconds.

Definition.name: AdjustTime

Documentation.firstline: Adjusts a time by incrementing or decrementing hour, minute and/or second values
Documentation.return: The adjusted Time_t value.
Documentation.content: Adjusts a time by incrementing or decrementing hour, minute and/or second values. If the new calculated time is invalid then it will be normalized according to mktime() rules.

param.name: hour_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the hour value; optional, defaults to zero.

param.name: minute_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the minute value; optional, defaults to zero.

param.name: second_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the second of month value; optional, defaults to zero.

Signature.name: AdjustTime
Signature.param: (Time_t time, INTEGER2 hour_delta = 0, INTEGER4 minute_delta = 0, INTEGER4 second_delta = 0)

Definition.Signature: Time_t AdjustTime(Time_t time, INTEGER2 hour_delta = 0, INTEGER4 minute_delta = 0, INTEGER4 second_delta = 0)

Documentation.firstline: Adjusts a time by adding or subtracting seconds
Documentation.return: The adjusted Time_t value.
Documentation.content: Adjusts a time by adding or subtracting seconds. If the new calculated time is invalid then it will be normalized according to mktime() rules.

param.name: seconds_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the time, in seconds.

Definition.name: AdjustSeconds

Documentation.firstline: Adjusts a Seconds_t value by adding or subtracting years, months, days, hours, minutes and/or seconds
Documentation.return: The adjusted Seconds_t value.
Documentation.content: Adjusts a Seconds_t value by adding or subtracting years, months, days, hours, minutes and/or seconds. This is performed by first converting the seconds into a full date/time structure, applying any delta values to individual date/time components, then converting the structure back to the number of seconds. This interim date must lie within Gregorian calendar after the year 1600. If the interim structure is found to have an invalid date/time then it will be normalized according to mktime() rules. Therefore, some delta values (such as "1 month") are actually relative to the value of the seconds argument.

param.name: seconds
param.desc: The number of seconds to adjust.

param.name: year_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the year value; optional, defaults to zero.

param.name: month_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the month value; optional, defaults to zero.

param.name: day_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the day of month value; optional, defaults to zero.

param.name: hour_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the hour value; optional, defaults to zero.

param.name: minute_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the minute value; optional, defaults to zero.

param.name: second_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the second of month value; optional, defaults to zero.

Signature.name: AdjustSeconds
Signature.param: (Seconds_t seconds, INTEGER2 year_delta = 0, INTEGER4 month_delta = 0, INTEGER4 day_delta = 0, INTEGER4 hour_delta = 0, INTEGER4 minute_delta = 0, INTEGER4 second_delta = 0)

Definition.Signature: Seconds_t AdjustSeconds(Seconds_t seconds, INTEGER2 year_delta = 0, INTEGER4 month_delta = 0, INTEGER4 day_delta = 0, INTEGER4 hour_delta = 0, INTEGER4 minute_delta = 0, INTEGER4 second_delta = 0)

Definition.name: AdjustCalendar

Documentation.firstline: Adjusts a date by incrementing or decrementing months and/or years
Documentation.return: The adjusted Date_t value.
Documentation.content: Adjusts a date by incrementing or decrementing months and/or years. This routine uses the rule outlined in McGinn v. State, 46 Neb. 427, 65 N.W. 46 (1895): "The term calendar month, whether employed in statutes or contracts, and not appearing to have been used in a different sense, denotes a period terminating with the day of the succeeding month numerically corresponding to the day of its beginning, less one. If there be no corresponding day of the succeeding month, it terminates with the last day thereof." The internet suggests similar legal positions exist in the Commonwealth and Germany. Note that day adjustments are performed after year and month adjustments using the preceding rules. As an example, Jan. 31, 2014 + 1 month will result in Feb. 28, 2014; Jan. 31, 2014 + 1 month + 1 day will result in Mar. 1, 2014.

param.name: date
param.desc: The date to adjust, in the Gregorian calendar after 1600.

param.name: year_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the year value; optional, defaults to zero.

param.name: month_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the month value; optional, defaults to zero.

param.name: day_delta
param.desc: The requested change to the day value; optional, defaults to zero.

Signature.name: AdjustCalendar
Signature.param: (Date_t date, INTEGER2 year_delta = 0, INTEGER4 month_delta = 0, INTEGER4 day_delta = 0)

Definition.Signature: Date_t AdjustCalendar(Date_t date, INTEGER2 year_delta = 0, INTEGER4 month_delta = 0, INTEGER4 day_delta = 0)

Documentation.firstline: Returns a boolean indicating whether daylight savings time is currently in effect locally
Documentation.return: TRUE if daylight savings time is currently in effect, FALSE otherwise.
Documentation.content: Returns a boolean indicating whether daylight savings time is currently in effect locally.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the offset (in seconds) of the time represented from UTC, with positive values indicating locations east of the Prime Meridian
Documentation.return: The number of seconds offset from UTC.
Documentation.content: Returns the offset (in seconds) of the time represented from UTC, with positive values indicating locations east of the Prime Meridian. Given a UTC time in seconds since epoch, you can find the local time by adding the result of this function to the seconds.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the current date
Documentation.return: A Date_t representing the current date.
Documentation.content: Returns the current date.

param.name: in_local_time
param.desc: TRUE if the returned value should be local to the cluster computing the date, FALSE for UTC. Optional, defaults to FALSE.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the current date in the local time zone
Documentation.return: A Date_t representing the current date.
Documentation.content: Returns the current date in the local time zone.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the current time of day
Documentation.return: A Time_t representing the current time of day.
Documentation.content: Returns the current time of day

param.name: in_local_time
param.desc: TRUE if the returned value should be local to the cluster computing the time, FALSE for UTC. Optional, defaults to FALSE.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the current date and time as the number of seconds since epoch
Documentation.return: A Seconds_t representing the current time in UTC or local time, depending on the argument.
Documentation.content: Returns the current date and time as the number of seconds since epoch.

param.name: in_local_time
param.desc: TRUE if the returned value should be local to the cluster computing the time, FALSE for UTC. Optional, defaults to FALSE.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the current date and time as the number of microseconds since epoch
Documentation.return: A Timestamp_t representing the current time in microseconds in UTC or local time, depending on the argument.
Documentation.content: Returns the current date and time as the number of microseconds since epoch.

param.name: in_local_time
param.desc: TRUE if the returned value should be local to the cluster computing the time, FALSE for UTC. Optional, defaults to FALSE.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the beginning and ending dates for the month surrounding the given date
Documentation.return: Module with exported attributes for startDate and endDate.
Documentation.content: Returns the beginning and ending dates for the month surrounding the given date.

param.name: as_of_date
param.desc: The reference date from which the month will be calculated. This date must be a date within the Gregorian calendar. Optional, defaults to the current date in UTC.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the beginning and ending dates for the week surrounding the given date (Sunday marks the beginning of a week)
Documentation.return: Module with exported attributes for startDate and endDate.
Documentation.content: Returns the beginning and ending dates for the week surrounding the given date (Sunday marks the beginning of a week).

param.name: as_of_date
param.desc: The reference date from which the week will be calculated. This date must be a date within the Gregorian calendar. Optional, defaults to the current date in UTC.

Definition.name: IsValidDate

Documentation.firstline: Tests whether a date is valid, both by range-checking the year and by validating each of the other individual components
Documentation.return: TRUE if the date is valid, FALSE otherwise.
Documentation.content: Tests whether a date is valid, both by range-checking the year and by validating each of the other individual components.

param.name: yearLowerBound
param.desc: The minimum acceptable year. Optional; defaults to 1800.

param.name: yearUpperBound
param.desc: The maximum acceptable year. Optional; defaults to 2100.

Definition.Signature: BOOLEAN IsValidDate(Date_t date, INTEGER2 yearLowerBound = 1800, INTEGER2 yearUpperBound = 2100)

Documentation.firstline: Tests whether a date is valid in the Gregorian calendar
Documentation.return: TRUE if the date is valid, FALSE otherwise.
Documentation.content: Tests whether a date is valid in the Gregorian calendar. The year must be between 1601 and 30827.

Documentation.firstline: Tests whether a time is valid
Documentation.return: TRUE if the time is valid, FALSE otherwise.
Documentation.content: Tests whether a time is valid.

Definition.name: CreateDate
Definition.Signature: Date_rec CreateDate(INTEGER2 year, UNSIGNED1 month, UNSIGNED1 day)

Documentation.firstline: A transform to create a Date_rec from the individual elements
Documentation.return: A transform that creates a Date_rec containing the date.
Documentation.content: A transform to create a Date_rec from the individual elements

Documentation.firstline: A transform to create a Date_rec from a Seconds_t value
Documentation.return: A transform that creates a Date_rec containing the date.
Documentation.content: A transform to create a Date_rec from a Seconds_t value.

Definition.name: CreateTime
Definition.Signature: Time_rec CreateTime(UNSIGNED1 hour, UNSIGNED1 minute, UNSIGNED1 second)

Documentation.firstline: A transform to create a Time_rec from the individual elements
Documentation.return: A transform that creates a Time_rec containing the time of day.
Documentation.content: A transform to create a Time_rec from the individual elements

Documentation.firstline: A transform to create a Time_rec from a Seconds_t value
Documentation.return: A transform that creates a Time_rec containing the time of day.
Documentation.content: A transform to create a Time_rec from a Seconds_t value.

Definition.name: CreateDateTime

Signature.name: CreateDateTime
Signature.param: (INTEGER2 year, UNSIGNED1 month, UNSIGNED1 day, UNSIGNED1 hour, UNSIGNED1 minute, UNSIGNED1 second)

Definition.Signature: DateTime_rec CreateDateTime(INTEGER2 year, UNSIGNED1 month, UNSIGNED1 day, UNSIGNED1 hour, UNSIGNED1 minute, UNSIGNED1 second)

Documentation.firstline: A transform to create a DateTime_rec from the individual elements
Documentation.return: A transform that creates a DateTime_rec containing date and time components.
Documentation.content: A transform to create a DateTime_rec from the individual elements

Documentation.firstline: A transform to create a DateTime_rec from a Seconds_t value
Documentation.return: A transform that creates a DateTime_rec containing date and time components.
